title: How communal violence swept Haryanaâ€™s Nuh and Gurugram: A timeline
content:
Communal violence in Haryanaâ€™s Nuh and Gurugram earlier this week left at least six people dead. Two home guards, an imam at a mosque and a Bajrang Dal member were among those who died.On Wednesday, Haryanaâ€™s Home Minister Anil Vij told reporters that social media played a crucial role in the violence and added that action would be taken against those who have posted anything provocative.â€œI urge people to not post anything on social media,â€ Vij said. â€œDo not forward posts blindly. You must realise that we are supervising every activity. We have to ensure peace and stability in our state first.â€The Bharatiya Janata Party leader told reporters that Hindus and Muslims in Nuh have been living peacefully. â€œThere is a conspiracy behind this,â€ Vij claimed. â€œThe way stones, weapons, bullets were found, it seems there is a mastermind behind this. We will conduct a detailed investigation and take strict actions against the people involved in this.â€The violence started as a clash between Hindus and Muslims during the Brij Mandal Jalabhishek Yatra, a procession organised by the Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad, on Monday. The Hindutva groups are components of the Sangh Parivar, of which the BJP is a political affiliate. The violence soon spread beyond Nuh, with Gurugram in particular witnessing widespread arson and mob attacks on Muslim homes and shops. Hereâ€™s a timeline of the violence so far:Gathering stormThe immediate trigger of the violence in Nuh may have been a video posted by Mohit Yadav alias Monu Manesar. The cow vigilante is wanted for the alleged murder of two Muslim men in February.In the video, shared on Facebook on July 30, Manesar urged Hindus to participate in the Brij Mandal Jalabhishek Yatra in Nuhâ€™s Mewat town. He himself would join, he declared, despite being a wanted man. He eventually did not turn up, however.Tension grips #Mewat and #Nuh as @MonuManesar one of the accused in #NasirJunaid murder announces participation in a rally by @BajrangDalOrg and @VHPDigital tomorrow . Death threats have been issued.He is wanted by @PoliceRajasthan @BharatpurPolice @TweetsMewat #MonuManesar pic.twitter.com/HRPfyWikXXâ€” Sumedha Sharma (@sumedhasharma86) July 30, 2023

Another cow vigilante named Bittu Bajrangi also uploaded a series of videos announcing his arrival in Mewat. â€œLet me share my location otherwise they will say that I visited my in-laws and did not even meet,â€ he said in one of the videos posted on July 30. Bajrangi also said that he was at Pali at the time and would be reaching Mewat soon. He was accompanied by some of his followers.First two videos of are of 1. Faridabad based cow viglante Bittu Bajrangi instigating violence and challenging Police in a facebook video 2 days back.  2. 3 days old video of Monu Manesar appealing to his supporters to attend the procession (he wasn't allowed to attend theâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/d9SbSWsL28â€” Mohammed Zubair (@zoo_bear) July 31, 2023

Another such video uploaded on July 30 featured a soundtrack with the lyrics: â€œGunshots will be fired, the father will remain the father.â€ The caption read, â€œI am coming to Mewat tomorrow.â€ Monday, that is.They exactly knew what they were up to. A day before riots in Mewat, He shared a video announcing that he will be in Mewat soon. 'Baap to baap rahega, goli woli challengi, goli pe goli challengi... ' Why would you say all this if they were to simply participate in yatra pic.twitter.com/YJnLn3cmlqâ€” Mohammed Zubair (@zoo_bear) August 2, 2023

Monday, July 31On Monday, just hours before violence erupted in Nuh, Vishwa Hindu Parishad General Secretary Surendra Jain was at Nalhar Mahadev Mandir in Mewat, where he delivered an incendiary speech against Muslims.â€œWe have to change the character of Mewat,â€ he declared. â€œMewat is not the land of cow killers, Hindu killers, ISI agents, Rohingya and Bangladeshi infiltrators, or those who convert Hindus.â€ He claimed that the ancestors of Indiaâ€™s Muslims were Hindus who had been forcibly converted. He also talked about the Gyanvapi mosque in Varanasi, warning that it would meet the same fate as the Babri Masjid in Ayodhya.â€œWe have to change the character of Mewat. Mewat is not the land of cow killers, Hindu killers, ISI agents, Rohingya/Bangladeshi infiltrators, or those who convert Hindus,â€ Surendra Jain of VHP told the crowd.â€” HindutvaWatch (@HindutvaWatchIn) August 2, 2023

Now, as the procession went through Nuh, it was pelted with stones by a mob of local Muslims. Initial reports suggested that the Hindu devotees participating in the procession had been stranded in a temple complex for several hours, surrounded by a violent mob.The head priest of the temple, Deepak Sharma, told Scroll that the procession reached the temple at around 1.30 pm. After about two hours, when some of the devotees set out to resume the yatra after lunch, they were attacked by Muslims on the road leading to the temple. â€œThe atmosphere was very tense and around 2,500 people were taking shelter in the temple,â€ Sharma said. The mob did not attack the temple, however. â€œThey were at least a kilometre away,â€ the priest said.The police arrived shortly after and dispersed the mob after a couple of hours. â€œBy 6 pm-6.30 pm everyone could go back home or wherever they were headed safely,â€ said the priest.Usha Kundu, additional superintendent of the Nuh police, said the mob was at a considerable distance from the temple. â€œWe were at the spot, but the mob was quite far away from the temple,â€ said Kundu.A video that subsequently emerged showed a man firing from inside the temple complex in Mewat. He was accompanied by several other men carrying guns. It also showed police personnel standing close by but doing nothing to control the situation.  The Person seen using the gun is 'Ashok Baba', Faridabad Bajrang Dal 'activists'. He had recently shared a Facebook post of him meeting Haryana Transport Minister Moolchand Sharma. pic.twitter.com/z7Ywvvh1SOâ€” Mohammed Zubair (@zoo_bear) August 2, 2023

Another video showed members of the Bajrang Dal carrying guns and shouting slogans of â€œJai Shri Ramâ€.Here is one more video of Bajrang Dal 'activists' with guns. Are they being identified?C'C: @police_haryana, @nuhpolice @Rao_InderjitS @Dchautala @anilvijminister @mlkhattar @cmohry pic.twitter.com/nUTeUBSFIEâ€” Mohammed Zubair (@zoo_bear) August 2, 2023

After the clashes in Nuh, Bajrang Dal leader Neeraj Vats had gone live on Facebook and urged Hindus to identify Muslims in their localities and target them.  After the eruption of violence, Bajrang Dal leader Neeraj Vats again went live on Facebook and ordered his supporters to target Muslims in other parts of the state. pic.twitter.com/1i2hpUlXdWâ€” HindutvaWatch (@HindutvaWatchIn) August 2, 2023

The violence soon spread across Nuh and Gurugram.  Tuesday, August 1In Gurugram, a mob burnt down a mosque in Sector 57 and killed its deputy imam, Mohammed Saad, in the early hours of Tuesday.According to a complaint filed by a sub inspector of the Gurugram police who witnessed the attack, a mob of â€œ90-100 peopleâ€ threw stones and fired at the police party deployed outside the mosque when they tried to intervene. â€œThey were armed with sticks and guns and were chanting slogans of Jai Shri Ram even as they surrounded the mosque from all sides,â€ the complaint said.Saadâ€™s brother, Mohammad Shadab, said his body bore several bullet injuries. â€œThere are cut marks on his neck too,â€ he said.#NuhViolence #NuhVoilence continued to spill over in #Gurgaon #Gurugram as a mosque in sector 57 was torched. One man sleeping inside was shot dead and he was not a maulana says @gurgaonpolice another burnt rushed to hospital. Internet suspended in #Sohna #Pataudi #Manesar . pic.twitter.com/s823Uo1Jwsâ€” Sumedha Sharma (@sumedhasharma86) August 1, 2023

A mob also set ablaze two shops in Gurugramâ€™s Badshahpur. Soon after, the Haryana government suspended mobile internet in Gurugram, Faridabad and Nuh until Wednesday.That night, however, mobs burned down a shop and several shanties in Sector 70. They set fire to the shanties after telling the families of Muslim migrant workers living in Sector 70 to pack up and leave. As panic set in, thousands of Muslims fled their homes even as the police assured them of safety. â€œWe donâ€™t have money to go back and even have debts to pay to the local shopkeepers,â€ a Muslim migrant worker, Shamim Hussain, 25, told NDTV. â€œItâ€™s okay if something happens to me, but I have a one-year-old son. It is my sincere request to the government, district administration and local residents to protect us. Help us, please.â€  Hundreds of Muslim residents in Gurugram say theyâ€™ve been threatened to vacate their houses in 2 days. The last 2 nights have been sleepless as they fear getting attacked after a domestic help was beaten up, just because his name was Rahman. pic.twitter.com/MlJuWrWCuyâ€” Priyanshi Sharma (@Priyanshi50) August 2, 2023

But this is Hindu-Muslim unity, where Hindus decided to stay with their Muslim family who couldn't flee, since their salaries weren't paid and didn't have money even to flee! #Gurugram pic.twitter.com/xnDVTMZLimâ€” Ankita Anand (@ankita_das_) August 1, 2023

The mobs also set fire to five godowns in Gurugram and vandalised two meat shops.   After sector 70 fires reported from two other locations. Reasons not confirmed so far @DC_Gurugram @gurgaonpolice ğŸ¤ for a peaceful night #Gurgaon #Gurugram #Haryana #NuhVoilence #Haryanaviolence #HaryanaNews pic.twitter.com/cIZQFwSKKXâ€” Sumedha Sharma (@sumedhasharma86) August 1, 2023

That was #Gurgaon #Gurugram #Haryana  for you today. After sleeping over Sohna Mayhem we woke up to mosque being torched Imam being shot dead and attack on shops and shanties. It's not about religion it's about who we are as city. This can't be millennium city. We can't be  #nuh pic.twitter.com/ST1cKpJDbBâ€” Sumedha Sharma (@sumedhasharma86) August 1, 2023

Ever since communal clashes fires are being reported across #Gurugram in scrap shops. This was kherki Daula. Just now fire reported in a house and scrap yard in Maruti Kunj area. Around 5 such fires reported since yesterday but things are normal. #GuruGramViolence #Gurgaon pic.twitter.com/woWINCCc1Yâ€” Sumedha Sharma (@sumedhasharma86) August 2, 2023

Wednesday, August 2The Vishwa Hindu Parishad and the Bajrang Dal organised protests across Delhi against the violence in Nuh and Gurugram. Although the Supreme Court had directed the authorities to ensure that there was no violence or hate speech at the protests, videos on social media showed the demonstrators outside the Nangloi police station in West Delhi calling for a boycott of Muslim businesses and the removal of Muslims tenants. One speaker said that the Delhi police must verify the identities of all tenants and street vendors . â€œWill we turn Delhi into UP or not?â€ he asked, amid loud cheering.Just in front of the  Police Station Gate and no action appears to have taken until this huge built up.....!!! It is a clear sign that the planning against minorities is state sponsored !!! A clear failure of Law and Order situations in the country! à¤…à¤ªà¤¨à¥‡ à¤­à¤¸à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤°à¥‹à¤‚ à¤•à¥‹ à¤…à¤­à¥€ à¤­à¥€â€¦ pic.twitter.com/DNQQ7myncfâ€” Wg Cdr Anuma Acharya (Retd) (@AnumaVidisha) August 1, 2023

In Gurugram, the police on Wednesday confirmed the death of Pradeep Sharma, a 32-year-old Bajrang Dal member, the Hindustan Times reported. He was attacked with a sharp object on Monday near the town of Sohna while he on his way to Gurugram.According to the police, Sharma sustained injuries all over his body, including his head. He was taken to the Safdarjung Hospital in Delhi, but succumbed to his injuries on Wednesday.Meanwhile, fresh violence was reported in Nuh, where miscreants attempted to set two mosques on fire in Tauru town on Wednesday night. The attacks took place even though Nuh was under curfew. Nobody was hurt, the police told Scroll.Two mosques in Tauru, Haryana's Nuh district, were burned down last night. Nuh police reached the spot and doused the fire. Security has been increased outside the mosques.#Nuh #Haryana pic.twitter.com/yR9JPNQcFVâ€” Meer Faisal (@meerfaisal01) August 3, 2023

As arson and vandalism continued in Gurugram, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar asked the central government to send four more teams of security forces. Twenty companies of central forces had already been deployed â€“ 14 in Nuh, three in Palwal, two in Gurugram, one in Faridabad.Thursday, August 3The Haryana police said they had registered 41 FIRs, arrested 116 people and detained 90.The government temporarily lifted the ban on mobile internet services between 1 pm and 4 pm in Nuh, Faridabad and Palwal to allow students appearing for examinations to download their admit cards.There have been no reports of fresh violence, but the situation remains tense.
